verses.verse: To the chief<WH5329> Musician<WH5329> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah,<WH7141> Maschil.<WH4905> We have heard<WH8085> with our ears,<WH241> O God,<WH430> our fathers<WH1> have told<WH5608> us, what work<WH6467> you did<WH6466> in their days,<WH3117> in the times<WH3117> of old.<WH6924>
How you did drive<WH3423> out the heathen<WH1471> with your hand,<WH3027> and planted<WH5193> them; how you did afflict<WH7489> the people,<WH3816> and cast<WH7971> them out.

For they got<WH3423> not the land<WH776> in possession<WH3423> by their own sword,<WH2719> neither<WH3808> did their own arm<WH2220> save<WH3467> them: but your right<WH3225> hand,<WH3225> and your arm,<WH2220> and the light<WH216> of your countenance,<WH6440> because<WH3588> you had a favor<WH7522> to them.
You are my King,<WH4428> O God:<WH430> command<WH6680> deliverances<WH3444> for Jacob.<WH3290>
Through you will we push<WH5055> down our enemies:<WH6862> through your name<WH8034> will we tread<WH947> them under that rise<WH6965> up against us.
For I will not trust<WH982> in my bow,<WH7198> neither<WH3808> shall my sword<WH2719> save<WH3467> me.
But you have saved<WH3467> us from our enemies,<WH6862> and have put them to shame<WH954> that hated<WH8130> us.
In God<WH430> we boast<WH1984> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long, and praise<WH3034> your name<WH8034> for ever.<WH5769> Selah.<WH5542>
But you have cast<WH2186> off, and put us to shame;<WH3637> and go<WH3318> not forth<WH3318> with our armies.<WH6635>
You make us to turn<WH7725> back<WH268> from the enemy:<WH6862> and they which hate<WH8130> us spoil<WH8154> for themselves.
You have given<WH5414> us like sheep<WH6629> appointed for meat;<WH3978> and have scattered<WH2219> us among the heathen.<WH1471>
You sell<WH4376> your people<WH5971> for nothing,<WH3808> <WH1952> and do not increase<WH7235> your wealth by their price.<WH4242>
You make<WH6213> us a reproach<WH2781> to our neighbors,<WH7934> a scorn<WH3933> and a derision<WH7047> to them that are round<WH5439> about us.
You make<WH6213> us a byword<WH4912> among the heathen,<WH1471> a shaking<WH4493> of the head<WH7218> among the people.<WH3816>
My confusion<WH3639> is continually<WH3117> before<WH5048> me, and the shame<WH1322> of my face<WH6440> has covered<WH3680> me,
For the voice<WH6963> of him that reproaches<WH2778> and blasphemes;<WH1442> by reason<WH6440> of the enemy<WH341> and avenger.<WH5358>
All<WH3605> this<WH2063> is come<WH935> on us; yet have we not forgotten<WH7911> you, neither<WH3808> have we dealt falsely<WH8266> in your covenant.<WH1285>
Our heart<WH3820> is not turned<WH5472> back,<WH268> neither have our steps<WH838> declined<WH5186> from your way;<WH734>
Though<WH3588> you have sore broken<WH1794> us in the place<WH4725> of dragons,<WH8577> and covered<WH3680> us with the shadow<WH6757> of death.<WH6757>
If<WH518> we have forgotten<WH7911> the name<WH8034> of our God,<WH430> or stretched<WH6566> out our hands<WH3709> to a strange<WH2114> god;<WH410>
Shall not God<WH430> search<WH2713> this<WH2063> out? for he knows<WH3045> the secrets<WH8587> of the heart.<WH3820>
Yes,<WH3588> for your sake are we killed<WH2026> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long; we are counted<WH2803> as sheep<WH6629> for the slaughter.<WH2878>
Awake,<WH5782> why<WH4100> sleep<WH3462> you, O Lord?<WH136> arise,<WH6974> cast<WH2186> us not off for ever.<WH5331>
Why<WH4100> hide<WH5641> you your face,<WH6440> and forget<WH7911> our affliction<WH6040> and our oppression?<WH3906>
For our soul<WH5315> is bowed<WH7743> down<WH7743> to the dust:<WH6083> our belly<WH990> sticks<WH1692> to the earth.<WH776>
Arise<WH6965> for our help,<WH5833> and redeem<WH6299> us for your mercies'<WH2617> sake.<WH4616>
